Name: Concubine figure
Description: The coarsely-worked votive figure of a woman reclining on a couch, she is wearing a wig, armlets and bracelets, details of which are picked out in black paint. Her face is coloured red. Beneath the head is a pillow and there is painted detail of a fringed sheet at the side of the couch.Such 'concubine' figures were placed in both tombs and homes, symbolic of rebirth and fertility.
